trailingComments.value:
*
 * The `DOMLocalization` class is responsible for fetching resources and
 * formatting translations.
 *
 * It implements the fallback strategy in case of errors encountered during the
 * formatting of translations and methods for observing DOM
 * trees with a `MutationObserver`.
A Set of DOM trees observed by the `MutationObserver`.

leadingComments.value: A Set of DOM trees observed by the `MutationObserver`.

trailingComments.value: requestAnimationFrame handler.

leadingComments.value: requestAnimationFrame handler.

trailingComments.value: list of elements pending for translation.

leadingComments.value: list of elements pending for translation.

*
   * @param {Array<String>}    resourceIds     - List of resource IDs
   * @param {Function}         generateBundles - Function that returns a
   *                                             generator over FluentBundles
   * @returns {DOMLocalization}

trailingComments.value:
* * Set the `data-l10n-id` and `data-l10n-args` attributes on DOM elements. * FluentDOM makes use of mutation observers to detect changes * to `data-l10n-*` attributes and translate elements asynchronously. * `setAttributes` is a convenience method which allows to translate * DOM elements declaratively. * * You should always prefer to use `data-l10n-id` on elements (statically in * HTML or dynamically via `setAttributes`) over manually retrieving * translations with `format`. The use of attributes ensures that the * elements can be retranslated when the user changes their language * preferences. * * ```javascript * localization.setAttributes( * document.querySelector('#welcome'), 'hello', { who: 'world' } * ); * ``` * * This will set the following attributes on the `#welcome` element. * The MutationObserver will pick up this change and will localize the element * asynchronously. * * ```html *

*

* ``` * * @param {Element} element - Element to set attributes on * @param {string} id - l10n-id string * @param {Object} args - KVP list of l10n arguments * @returns {Element}

leadingComments.value:
* * Set the `data-l10n-id` and `data-l10n-args` attributes on DOM elements. * FluentDOM makes use of mutation observers to detect changes * to `data-l10n-*` attributes and translate elements asynchronously. * `setAttributes` is a convenience method which allows to translate * DOM elements declaratively. * * You should always prefer to use `data-l10n-id` on elements (statically in * HTML or dynamically via `setAttributes`) over manually retrieving * translations with `format`. The use of attributes ensures that the * elements can be retranslated when the user changes their language * preferences. * * ```javascript * localization.setAttributes( * document.querySelector('#welcome'), 'hello', { who: 'world' } * ); * ``` * * This will set the following attributes on the `#welcome` element. * The MutationObserver will pick up this change and will localize the element * asynchronously. * * ```html *

*

* ``` * * @param {Element} element - Element to set attributes on * @param {string} id - l10n-id string * @param {Object} args - KVP list of l10n arguments * @returns {Element}

trailingComments.value:
*
   * Get the `data-l10n-*` attributes from DOM elements.
   *
   * ```javascript
   * localization.getAttributes(
   *   document.querySelector('#welcome')
   * );
   * // -> { id: 'hello', args: { who: 'world' } }
   * ```
   *
   * @param   {Element}  element - HTML element
   * @returns {{id: string, args: Object}}

leadingComments.value:
*
   * Get the `data-l10n-*` attributes from DOM elements.
   *
   * ```javascript
   * localization.getAttributes(
   *   document.querySelector('#welcome')
   * );
   * // -> { id: 'hello', args: { who: 'world' } }
   * ```
   *
   * @param   {Element}  element - HTML element
   * @returns {{id: string, args: Object}}

trailingComments.value:
*
   * Add `newRoot` to the list of roots managed by this `DOMLocalization`.
   *
   * Additionally, if this `DOMLocalization` has an observer, start observing
   * `newRoot` in order to translate mutations in it.
   *
   * @param {Element}      newRoot - Root to observe.

extra.rawValue: Cannot add a root that overlaps with existing root.

value.raw:
Cannot connect a root:
          DOMLocalization already has a root from a different window.

leadingComments.value:
*
   * Add `newRoot` to the list of roots managed by this `DOMLocalization`.
   *
   * Additionally, if this `DOMLocalization` has an observer, start observing
   * `newRoot` in order to translate mutations in it.
   *

trailingComments.value:
*
   * Remove `root` from the list of roots managed by this `DOMLocalization`.
   *
   * Additionally, if this `DOMLocalization` has an observer, stop observing
   * `root`.
   *
   * Returns `true` if the root was the last one managed by this
   * `DOMLocalization`.
   *
   * @param   {Element} root - Root to disconnect.
   * @returns {boolean}
Pause the mutation observer to stop observing `root`.

leadingComments.value: Pause the mutation observer to stop observing `root`.

trailingComments.value: Resume observing all other roots.

This fragment allows us to coalesce all pending translations
into a single requestAnimationFrame.

leadingComments.value: This fragment allows us to coalesce all pending translations
into a single requestAnimationFrame.

*
   * Translate mutations detected by the `MutationObserver`.
   *
   * @private

trailingComments.value:
*
   * Translate a DOM element or fragment asynchronously using this
   * `DOMLocalization` object.
   *
   * Manually trigger the translation (or re-translation) of a DOM fragment.
   * Use the `data-l10n-id` and `data-l10n-args` attributes to mark up the DOM
   * with information about which translations to use.
   *
   * Returns a `Promise` that gets resolved once the translation is complete.
   *
   * @param   {DOMFragment} frag - Element or DocumentFragment to be translated
   * @returns {Promise}

leadingComments.value:
*
   * Translate a DOM element or fragment asynchronously using this
   * `DOMLocalization` object.
   *
   * Manually trigger the translation (or re-translation) of a DOM fragment.
   * Use the `data-l10n-id` and `data-l10n-args` attributes to mark up the DOM
   * with information about which translations to use.
   *
   * Returns a `Promise` that gets resolved once the translation is complete.
   *
   * @param   {DOMFragment} frag - Element or DocumentFragment to be translated
   * @returns {Promise}

trailingComments.value:
*
   * Translate a list of DOM elements asynchronously using this
   * `DOMLocalization` object.
   *
   * Manually trigger the translation (or re-translation) of a list of elements.
   * Use the `data-l10n-id` and `data-l10n-args` attributes to mark up the DOM
   * with information about which translations to use.
   *
   * Returns a `Promise` that gets resolved once the translation is complete.
   *
   * @param   {Array<Element>} elements - List of elements to be translated
   * @returns {Promise}

leadingComments.value:
*
   * Translate a list of DOM elements asynchronously using this
   * `DOMLocalization` object.

   * Manually trigger the translation (or re-translation) of a list of elements.
   * Use the `data-l10n-id` and `data-l10n-args` attributes to mark up the DOM
   * with information about which translations to use.
   *
   * Returns a `Promise` that gets resolved once the translation is complete.
   *
   * @param   {Array<Element>} elements - List of elements to be translated
   * @returns {Promise}

*
 * The `DOMLocalization` class is responsible for fetching resources and
 * formatting translations.
 *
 * It implements the fallback strategy in case of errors encountered during the
 * formatting of translations and methods for observing DOM
 * trees with a `MutationObserver`.

*
 * The `DOMLocalization` class is responsible for fetching resources and
 * formatting translations.
 *
 * It implements the fallback strategy in case of errors encountered during the
 * formatting of translations and methods for observing DOM
 * trees with a `MutationObserver`.

*

 * formatting translations.
 *
 * It implements the fallback strategy in case of errors encountered during the
 * formatting of translations and methods for observing DOM
 * trees with a `MutationObserver`.

*

   * @param {Function}         generateBundles - Function that returns a

A Set of DOM trees observed by the `MutationObserver`.
requestAnimationFrame handler.
list of elements pending for translation.

* * Set the `data-l10n-id` and `data-l10n-args` attributes on DOM elements. * FluentDOM makes use of mutation observers to detect changes * to `data-l10n-*` attributes and translate elements asynchronously. * `setAttributes` is a convenience method which allows to translate * DOM elements declaratively. * * You should always prefer to use `data-l10n-id` on elements (statically in * HTML or dynamically via `setAttributes`) over manually retrieving * translations with `format`. The use of attributes ensures that the * elements can be retranslated when the user changes their language * preferences. * * ```javascript * localization.setAttributes( * document.querySelector('#welcome'), 'hello', { who: 'world' } * ); * ``` * * This will set the following attributes on the `#welcome` element. * The MutationObserver will pick up this change and will localize the element * asynchronously. * * ```html *

*

* ``` * * @param {Element} element - Element to set attributes on * @param {string} id - l10n-id string * @param {Object} args - KVP list of l10n arguments * @returns {Element}

*
   * Get the `data-l10n-*` attributes from DOM elements.
   *
   * ```javascript
   * localization.getAttributes(
   *   document.querySelector('#welcome')
   * );
   * // -> { id: 'hello', args: { who: 'world' } }
   * ```
   *
   * @param   {Element}  element - HTML element
   * @returns {{id: string, args: Object}}

*
   * Add `newRoot` to the list of roots managed by this `DOMLocalization`.
   *
   * Additionally, if this `DOMLocalization` has an observer, start observing
   * `newRoot` in order to translate mutations in it.
   *
   * @param {Element}      newRoot - Root to observe.

*
   * Remove `root` from the list of roots managed by this `DOMLocalization`.
   *
   * Additionally, if this `DOMLocalization` has an observer, stop observing
   * `root`.
   *
   * Returns `true` if the root was the last one managed by this
   * `DOMLocalization`.
   *
   * @param   {Element} root - Root to disconnect.
   * @returns {boolean}
Pause the mutation observer to stop observing `root`.
Resume observing all other roots.

This fragment allows us to coalesce all pending translations
into a single requestAnimationFrame.

*
   * Translate a DOM element or fragment asynchronously using this
   * `DOMLocalization` object.
   *
   * Manually trigger the translation (or re-translation) of a DOM fragment.
   * Use the `data-l10n-id` and `data-l10n-args` attributes to mark up the DOM
   * with information about which translations to use.
   *
   * Returns a `Promise` that gets resolved once the translation is complete.
   *
   * @param   {DOMFragment} frag - Element or DocumentFragment to be translated
   * @returns {Promise}

*
   * Translate a list of DOM elements asynchronously using this
   * `DOMLocalization` object.
   *
   * Manually trigger the translation (or re-translation) of a list of elements.
   * Use the `data-l10n-id` and `data-l10n-args` attributes to mark up the DOM
   * with information about which translations to use.
   *
   * Returns a `Promise` that gets resolved once the translation is complete.
   *
   * @param   {Array<Element>} elements - List of elements to be translated
   * @returns {Promise}

*
   * Applies translations onto elements.
   *
   * @param {Array<Element>} elements
   * @param {Array<Object>}  translations
   * @private

*
   * Collects all translatable child elements of the element.
   *
   * @param {Element} element
   * @returns {Array<Element>}
   * @private

*
   * Get the `data-l10n-*` attributes from DOM elements as a two-element
   * array.
   *
   * @param {Element} element
   * @returns {Object}
   * @private

*
 * The `DOMLocalization` class is responsible for fetching resources and
 * formatting translations.
 *
 * It implements the fallback strategy in case of errors encountered during the
 * formatting of translations and methods for observing DOM
 * trees with a `MutationObserver`.

*
   * @param {Array<String>}    resourceIds     - List of resource IDs
   * @param {Function}         generateBundles - Function that returns a
   *                                             generator over FluentBundles
   * @returns {DOMLocalization}
A Set of DOM trees observed by the `MutationObserver`.
list of elements pending for translation.

* * Set the `data-l10n-id` and `data-l10n-args` attributes on DOM elements. * FluentDOM makes use of mutation observers to detect changes * to `data-l10n-*` attributes and translate elements asynchronously. * `setAttributes` is a convenience method which allows to translate * DOM elements declaratively. * * You should always prefer to use `data-l10n-id` on elements (statically in * HTML or dynamically via `setAttributes`) over manually retrieving * translations with `format`. The use of attributes ensures that the * elements can be retranslated when the user changes their language * preferences. * * ```javascript * localization.setAttributes( * document.querySelector('#welcome'), 'hello', { who: 'world' } * ); * ``` * * This will set the following attributes on the `#welcome` element. * The MutationObserver will pick up this change and will localize the element * asynchronously. * * ```html *

*

* ``` * * @param {Element} element - Element to set attributes on * @param {string} id - l10n-id string * @param {Object} args - KVP list of l10n arguments * @returns {Element}

*
   * Get the `data-l10n-*` attributes from DOM elements.
   *
   * ```javascript
   * localization.getAttributes(
   *   document.querySelector('#welcome')
   * );
   * // -> { id: 'hello', args: { who: 'world' } }
   * ```
   *
   * @param   {Element}  element - HTML element
   * @returns {{id: string, args: Object}}

*
   * Add `newRoot` to the list of roots managed by this `DOMLocalization`.
   *
   * Additionally, if this `DOMLocalization` has an observer, start observing
   * `newRoot` in order to translate mutations in it.
   *
   * @param {Element}      newRoot - Root to observe.
Cannot add a root that overlaps with existing root.

Cannot connect a root:
          DOMLocalization already has a root from a different window.

*
   * Remove `root` from the list of roots managed by this `DOMLocalization`.
   *
   * Additionally, if this `DOMLocalization` has an observer, stop observing
   * `root`.
   *
   * Returns `true` if the root was the last one managed by this
   * `DOMLocalization`.

   * @returns {boolean}

This fragment allows us to coalesce all pending translations

*
   * Translate a DOM element or fragment asynchronously using this
   * `DOMLocalization` object.
   *
   * Manually trigger the translation (or re-translation) of a DOM fragment.
   * Use the `data-l10n-id` and `data-l10n-args` attributes to mark up the DOM
   * with information about which translations to use.
   *
   * Returns a `Promise` that gets resolved once the translation is complete.
   *
   * @param   {DOMFragment} frag - Element or DocumentFragment to be translated
   * @returns {Promise}

*
   * Translate a list of DOM elements asynchronously using this
   * `DOMLocalization` object.
   *
   * Manually trigger the translation (or re-translation) of a list of elements.
   * Use the `data-l10n-id` and `data-l10n-args` attributes to mark up the DOM
   * with information about which translations to use.
   *
   * Returns a `Promise` that gets resolved once the translation is complete.
   *
   * @param   {Array<Element>} elements - List of elements to be translated
   * @returns {Promise}

*
   * Applies translations onto elements.

   * @param {Array<Object>}  translations
